Most Illustrious Sir

Despite what was ordered to you by the circular dated yesterday, addressed to all chiefs of police, I must add that your orders in this regard must be final, deploying all energy against those who, without just cause, do not wish to respond to the call of the Fatherland in the present crisis, holding them responsible to the government for the neglect and weakness with which they behave, and sending those most neglectful in carrying out their orders, detained, to this capital.

God keep Your Lordship  
Secretary of War and Navy Affairs in Caçapava, December 20, 1839.  
Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of the Boqueirão Department.  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Letter from the Most Excellent Minister of War dated December 20, received on the 27th of the same month.  
Presidency Secretariat of the Republic

Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães, Chief of Police of the Boqueirão Department.  
From the Ministry of War.
